Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mytilin C (Arg-rich; 3S=S, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; mollusca/molluscs/mollusks, marine invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis:  APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (73.53%) toMytilin BR: 23%; C: 23%; S=T=13%. GRAVY: -0.54; mol wt: 3720.425: Mol formula: C152H244N56O40S7; Mol ex Coeff: 6397.5 (Cys paired).Activity: Active against Gram+ M. luteus (MIC 0.7-1.4 uM), S. aureus  (MIC 0.7-1.4 uM),L. monocytogenes (MIC 0.7-1.4 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 2.8â€“5.6 uM), Gram- E. coli D31 (MIC 0.35-0.7 uM), S-newport (MIC > 11.2 uM), S. typhimurium (MIC 19-38 uM), B-suis (MIC >11.2 uM), P-aeruginosa (MIC >11.2 uM),  E. aerogenes (MIC 1.4-2.8 uM), V. harvey (MIC 1.4-2.8 uM), V. alginolyticus (MIC 1.4-2.8 uM), V. vulnificus (MIC 1.4-2.8 uM), V. splendidus (MIC 1.4-2.8 uM), fungi F-oxysporum (MIC >5.6 uM), and Protozoan P-marinus (MIC >20 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Mitta G, Vandenbulcke F, Hubert F, Salzet M, Roch P.2000
Literature Information.Title: Involvement of mytilins in mussel antimicrobial defense
